content.text: Staphylococcal TSS is a toxin-mediated illness caused by Staphylococcus aureus. It is classically associated with tampon use in menstruating women, but it can also occur in other settings such as surgical wound infections.

items: Desquamation, particularly of the palms and soles, 1-2 weeks after onset of illness
Involvement of three or more organ systems

content.text: Management includes aggressive fluid replacement, vasopressors, and removal of the source of infection (e.g., tampon removal, wound debridement).

regimenData.notes: Clindamycin is used for its antitoxin effect. Vancomycin is used for MRSA coverage, while nafcillin or oxacillin is used for MSSA.
